medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute mitral regurgitation and pulmonary edema.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed vomiting six days before admission, occurring daily with bile-stained vomitus containing red mucus. Three days before admission, he began to experience cramping pain in the upper abdomen and pain in the anterior aspect of the chest. He entered another hospital three days prior to admission. His symptoms and recent experiences suggest an acute progression.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Juvenile spondyloarthropathy diagnosed two years earlier with intermittent acral arthralgia affecting mainly the left wrist. Previously experienced painless hematuria several months prior.
medical_history.family_history: A maternal grandfather had rheumatoid arthritis, and a paternal grandmother had systemic lupus erythematosus.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a high-school student and reported no use of illicit drugs, alcohol, or tobacco.
